biography: North Atlantic Oscillation are an electronic rock band based in Scotland. They released their first single 'Some Blue Hive' on One Records in June 2007. In 2009 the band signed to Kscope - a Snapper Music label - and released an EP called 'Callsigns'. Their debut album 'Grappling Hooks' was released to critical acclaim in the UK in March 2010. Throughout this period, the band toured the UK and Europe with Porcupine Tree, Anathema and Blackfield. 2012 saw the release of the bands second album, Fog Electric, co-produced by Tony Doogan. In 2013 the band's vocalist/songwriter Sam Healy released an acclaimed solo album under the name SAND. More info: http://www.sandtheband.com In August 2014, North Atlantic Oscillation announced their third studio album 'The Third Day'. The album was released on 6 October 2014 via Kscope. In 2016 Healy released a second Sand album, A Sleeper, Just Awake, on the Vineland Music label. In November 2018, North Atlantic Oscillation will release their fourth album 'Grind Show' on the Vineland Music label. Videos: Soft Coda - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZkAhSSeR8j0 Savage With Barometer - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nGB_g9w8wuU Drawing Maps From Memory - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ds63qVri0I Links: https://www.facebook.com/northatlanticoscillation https://twitter.com/northatlanticos http://www.fogelectric.co.uk http://www.sandtheband.com http://www.kscopemusic.com/northatlanticoscillation/ Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
